title: Christian Pulisic hits perfect hat-trick as Chelsea put four past error-strewn Burnley
text:
Christian Pulisic’s perfect hat-trick suggested Chelsea’s £58 million American international is a man in a hurry at Turf Moor on Saturday night in a team performance that also hinted that Frank Lampard’s Chelsea revolution is gaining unstoppable momentum.

Three days removed from a memorable European victory at Ajax, this was supposed to be a test of Chelsea’s mental and physical fortitude, a rain and wind-swept ordeal in deepest Lancashire.

Yet, cliches and stereotypes were consigned firmly to the dustbin thanks to a perfect hat-trick - left-foot, right-foot, head - from Pulisic, the all-American kid from the chocolate capital of the United States, Hershey, Pennsylvania.

“There has been a lot of talk around Christian, for the big price tag, for the fact he’s a star in his country and captains the USA so well,” said Lampard.

“I get asked those questions so I’m delighted to see him do that today because I know the pressures, I know the backstory of the pressures of a move like that.

“I also know he played for his country this summer and had one week’s break and then you get the pressure of 'can you settle in the Premier League?'

“So I tried to deal with it in the way I see best which is to give him minutes but I have competition in that area. Christian has been doing it from the bench, fully deserved his start and it was a fantastic match-winning performance. I know what a good player he is.”
